trans-unit.source: Rigidbodies move based on physical forces applied to them, such as gravity and collisions. Typical rigidbodies are boxes, balls, furniture, and so on — objects that are pushed, pulled, and knocked around, and also have effects on other rigidbodies they collide with.
trans-unit.target: Rigidbodies move based on physical forces applied to them, such as gravity and collisions. Typical rigidbodies are boxes, balls, furniture, and so on — objects that are pushed, pulled, and knocked around, and also have effects on other rigidbodies they collide with.

trans-unit.source: Select the entity you want to be a rigidbody collider.
trans-unit.target: Select the entity you want to be a rigidbody collider.

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid, click Add component and select Rigidbody.
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid, click Add component and select Rigidbody.

trans-unit.source: Set the collider shape to match the entity. To do this, in the Property Grid, expand the Rigidbody component to view its properties.
trans-unit.target: Set the collider shape to match the entity. To do this, in the Property Grid, expand the Rigidbody component to view its properties.

trans-unit.source: Next to Collider Shapes, click Green plus button (Add) and select the shape you want.
trans-unit.target: Next to Collider Shapes, click Green plus button (Add) and select the shape you want.

trans-unit.source: You can adjust the rigidbody properties in the Property Grid.
trans-unit.target: You can adjust the rigidbody properties in the Property Grid.

trans-unit.source: Sets which collision group the object belongs to.
trans-unit.target: Sets which collision group the object belongs to.

trans-unit.source: Sets which groups the object collides with.
trans-unit.target: Sets which groups the object collides with.

trans-unit.source: If this is enabled, the object reports collision events, which you can use in scripts. It has no effect on physics. If you have no scripts using collision events for the object, disable this option to save CPU.
trans-unit.target: If this is enabled, the object reports collision events, which you can use in scripts. It has no effect on physics. If you have no scripts using collision events for the object, disable this option to save CPU.

trans-unit.source: If this is enabled, the physics engine doesn't process physics objects when they're not moving. This saves CPU.
trans-unit.target: If this is enabled, the physics engine doesn't process physics objects when they're not moving. This saves CPU.

trans-unit.source: Sets the amount of kinetic energy lost or gained after a collision. A typical value is between 0 and 1. If the restitution property of colliding entities is 0, the entities lose all energy and stop moving immediately on impact. If the restitution is 1, they lose no energy and rebound with the same velocity they collided at. Use this to change the "bounciness" of rigidbodies.
trans-unit.target: Sets the amount of kinetic energy lost or gained after a collision. A typical value is between 0 and 1. If the restitution property of colliding entities is 0, the entities lose all energy and stop moving immediately on impact. If the restitution is 1, they lose no energy and rebound with the same velocity they collided at. Use this to change the "bounciness" of rigidbodies.

trans-unit.source: Sets the velocity at which continuous collision detection (CCD) takes over. CCD prevents fast-moving entities (such as bullets) erroneously passing through other entities.
trans-unit.target: Sets the velocity at which continuous collision detection (CCD) takes over. CCD prevents fast-moving entities (such as bullets) erroneously passing through other entities.

trans-unit.source: Sets the radius of the bounding sphere containing the position between two physics frames during continuous collision detection.
trans-unit.target: Sets the radius of the bounding sphere containing the position between two physics frames during continuous collision detection.

trans-unit.source: Toggles whether the rigidbody is a trigger.
trans-unit.target: Toggles whether the rigidbody is a trigger.

trans-unit.source: Toggles whether the rigidbody is kinematic and therefore moved only by its Transform property.
trans-unit.target: Toggles whether the rigidbody is kinematic and therefore moved only by its Transform property.

trans-unit.source: Sets the collider mass. For large differences, use a point value; for example, write 0.1 or 10, not 1 or 100000.
trans-unit.target: Sets the collider mass. For large differences, use a point value; for example, write 0.1 or 10, not 1 or 100000.

trans-unit.source: The amount of damping for directional forces.
trans-unit.target: The amount of damping for directional forces.

trans-unit.source: The amount of damping for rotational forces.
trans-unit.target: The amount of damping for rotational forces.

trans-unit.source: Overrides gravity with the vector specified in Gravity.
trans-unit.target: Overrides gravity with the vector specified in Gravity.

trans-unit.source: Sets a custom gravity vector applied if Override Gravity is selected.
trans-unit.target: Sets a custom gravity vector applied if Override Gravity is selected.

trans-unit.source: If the collider entity contains a bone structure, the node name can refer to a bones node name to be linked to that specific bone.
trans-unit.target: If the collider entity contains a bone structure, the node name can refer to a bones node name to be linked to that specific bone.
